definition: to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to murder without blinking an eye (idiom)/ruthless/cold-blooded

sentences.english: These patients are told to blink their eyes and to respire through their noses.
sentences.chinese: 八位患者並告之以眨眼動作，並由鼻孔呼吸。

sentences.english: The couple had a heck of an argument and kept us awake all night.
sentences.chinese: 爭得夠嗆，弄得咱們一晚上沒眨眼皮。

sentences.english: I hardly noticed the 11 months spent in Spain.
sentences.chinese: 在西班牙的11個月也眨眼間就結束了。

sentences.english: She conjured up a whole meal in a jiffy.
sentences.chinese: 一眨眼工夫她就變出了一桌飯菜。

sentences.english: I noticed him winking at his brother.
sentences.chinese: 我注意到他他兄弟眨眼示意。

sentences.english: Blinking lubricates the eye and rests it.
sentences.chinese: 眨眼睛能使眼睛溼潤而覺得舒適。

sentences.english: But don’t worry; God never blinks.
sentences.chinese: 但是不要擔憂，上帝不眨眼。

sentences.english: Fiona pointed her watch at the bars and in a blink of an eye, it disappeared.
sentences.chinese: 霏歐納把表對準了柵欄，眨眼之間它就不見了。

sentences.english: Hillary was a good choice, she can tell a lie without even blinking.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里是一個不錯的選擇，丫簡直說謊不帶眨眼的。
我很喜歡那眨眼驅動自拍器。

sentences.english: Mr. Hillme, her social-studies teacher and accompanist, winked at her.
sentences.chinese: 希爾米先生是她的社會課老師兼伴奏，向她眨眼示意。

sentences.english: Afterwards, blink or squeeze your eyes shut to relax them.
sentences.chinese: 然後，眨眼睛或者眯起眼睛來放鬆眼球。
“它，它沒燃燒，”達多眨了眨眼睛。

sentences.english: It stares blankly at him, taking in shuddering breaths of the poisonous air.
sentences.chinese: 它對着傑克眨眼，呼吸着那有毒的空氣。

sentences.english: Aziraphale blinked, lowered his hands, and gingerly opened the door.
sentences.chinese: 亞茨拉斐爾眨眨眼，放下手，小心翼翼的打開車門。

definition: in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
in a flash/in the blink of an eye/to glance
period of time (may be months, or mere seconds)/spare time/skill/labor/effort
(of passing time) in an instant/(of a sight) in a flash
in the wink of an eye/in a flash
